description: s3Dgraphy nodes datamodel including node types with CIDOC-CRM mappings

Node.description: Base class for all nodes in the graph with CIDOC mapping

StratigraphicNode.description: Base class for all stratigraphic units within the graph structure. Inherits from Node and provides additional functionality specific to stratigraphy.

US.label: US (or SU)
US.description: Stratigraphic Unit (SU) or negative stratigraphic unit. Represents a physical stratigraphic unit (positive or negative). It corresponds to an identifiable physical layer or interface in archaeological documentation.

mapping.alternative: E26 Physical Feature + A8 Stratigraphic Unit

USVs.label: USV/s
USVs.description: Structural Virtual Stratigraphic Unit (USV/s). Represents a virtual reconstruction of structural elements, such as walls, columns, or other architectural components that are no longer physically present but can be reconstructed based on archaeological evidence.

mapping.alternative: E89 Propositional Object + A8 Stratigraphic Unit

USVn.label: USV/n
USVn.description: Non-structural Virtual Stratigraphic Unit (USV/n). Represents a virtual reconstruction of non-structural elements, such as furniture, decorations, or other non-load bearing components that are no longer physically present but can be reconstructed based on archaeological evidence.

mapping.alternative: E89 Propositional Object + A8 Stratigraphic Unit

SF.label: Special Find
SF.description: Not in situ element that needs repositioning. Represents an object of particular interest found in stratigraphic contexts, such as architectural artifacts, coins, or other significant objects that are not in their original position.

VSF.label: Virtual Special Find
VSF.description: Hypothetical reconstruction of a fragmented Special Find. Represents a virtual reconstruction of a special find that is fragmented or incomplete, based on archaeological evidence and reasonable inferences.

mapping.alternative: E89 Propositional Object + E19 Physical Object

serSU.label: US series
serSU.description: Series of Stratigraphic Units (SU). Represents a grouping of multiple related stratigraphic units for organizational or analytical purposes.

serUSVn.label: USVn series
serUSVn.description: Series of non-structural Virtual Stratigraphic Units. Represents a grouping of multiple non-structural virtual stratigraphic units.

serUSVs.label: USVs series
serUSVs.description: Series of Structural Virtual Stratigraphic Units. Represents a grouping of multiple structural virtual stratigraphic units.

USD.label: USD
USD.symbol: white round rectangle with orange border
USD.description: Documentary Stratigraphic Unit. Represents a conceptual stratigraphic unit based on historical or documentary sources rather than direct physical evidence.

TSU.label: TSU
TSU.symbol: dotted white rectangle with red border
TSU.description: Transformation Unit. Represents a process of change in a stratigraphic unit.

BR.label: continuity node
BR.description: End of life of a US/USV. Marks the point where a stratigraphic unit ceases to exist.

SE.label: stratigraphic event node
SE.description: A stratigraphic event is the process or event that leads to the formation or alteration of a stratigraphic unit. It is distinct from the unit itself, which represents the result or outcome of the event. The event can be thought of as a precursor and can be paired with its resulting unit to provide a more detailed temporal range. This allows for the documentation of both the initial moment of action (e.g., the start of construction, a collapse, or an incision) and the final state (the resulting unit that persists over time).

EpochNode.label: Epoch
EpochNode.description: Node representing a temporal epoch. It is a convenient grouping that allows attributing a series of actions to a temporal delta. Once the specific chronology data, expressed as start_time and end_time properties of individual SUs, is defined through dating elements, these epoch nodes are ignored where such specific data are available.

GroupNode.description: Node that represents a group of nodes. These groups can be of various types: see subclasses below.

ActivityNodeGroup.label: Activity Node Group
ActivityNodeGroup.description: Group node for activities. An activity is a logical group of actions that are kept together for a narrative purpose and information order (e.g., construction of a room of a building in year x, restoration activities of various parts of that room 20 years later).

ParadataNodeGroup.label: Paradata Node Group
ParadataNodeGroup.description: Group node for paradata. This group brings together all paradata related to a stratigraphic unit: typically named '[US_name]_PD' (ParaData).

TimeBranchNodeGroup.label: Time Branch Node Group
TimeBranchNodeGroup.description: Group node to aggregate all elements belonging to a time branch. Two TB can be connected by a 'contrasts_with' edge.

ParadataNode.description: Base class for nodes representing metadata or information on how the data was generated.

PropertyNode.label: Property
PropertyNode.description: Node that represents a property associated with another node. Attributes: value (any): Value of the property. property_type (str): Type of property (e.g. 'Height', 'Length', etc.). data (dict): Additional metadata, such as 'author', 'time_start', 'time_end'.

DocumentNode.label: Document
DocumentNode.description: Node that represents a document or source. Attributes: data (dict): Additional metadata, such as 'url_type'.

ExtractorNode.label: Extractor
ExtractorNode.description: Node that represents the extraction of information from a source. Attributes: source (str): Source from which the information was extracted. data (dict): Additional metadata, such as 'author', 'url_type', 'icon', etc.

CombinerNode.label: Combiner
CombinerNode.description: Node that represents reasoning that combines information from multiple sources. Attributes: sources (list): List of combined sources. data (dict): Additional metadata, such as 'author'.

GeoPositionNode.label: Geo Position
GeoPositionNode.description: Class to represent a GeoPosition node in the graph. Attributes: type (str): Node type, set to 'geo_position'. data (dict): Data related to geographic position.

LinkNode.label: Link
LinkNode.description: Class to represent a link node (LinkNode) in the graph. Attributes: url (str): URL of the link. url_type (str): Type of URL (e.g., 'External link', 'Image'). description (str): Description of the link.

mapping.alternative: E73 Information Object + E36 Visual Item

RepresentationModelNode.label: Representation Model
RepresentationModelNode.description: Node that represents a 3D model or a spatialized image.

mapping.alternative: D1 Digital Object + SP6 Declarative Place + E52 Time-Span

RepresentationModelDocNode.label: Representation Model Document
RepresentationModelDocNode.description: Node that represents a 3D model or a spatialized image. It is used to instanciate documents, extractors or combiner nodes within the scene. An example is an hystorical photo positioned in its original position.

mapping.alternative: D1 Digital Object + SP6 Declarative Place + E52 Time-Span

RepresentationModelSpecialFindNode.label: Representation Model Special Find
RepresentationModelSpecialFindNode.description: Node that represents a 3D model or a spatialized image. It is used to instanciate special finds in the scene. An example is a scanned 3D model of a capital repositioned in its original position according to an anastylosis hypothesis.

mapping.alternative: D1 Digital Object + SP6 Declarative Place + E52 Time-Span

SemanticShapeNode.label: Semantic Shape
SemanticShapeNode.description: Node that represents a semantic shape in 3D space. Can be a proxy of a stratigraphic unit or a generic annotation. Supports the definition of convex shapes (convexshapes) and spheres (spheres) for geometric representation.

mapping.alternative: SP5 Geometric Place Expression + E36 Visual Item

AuthorNode.label: Author
AuthorNode.description: Class to represent an author node in the graph. Attributes: orcid (str): ORCID identifier of the author (optional). name (str): Name of the author (optional). surname (str): Surname of the author (optional).

UnknownNode.label: Unknown node
UnknownNode.description: Fallback node for unrecognized types. This type of node should not normally appear in the system but serves exclusively to handle anomalies in the data.
